Secondary Offense: child labor or youth employment violation
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Company: TARGET CORP - N CA DISTRIBUTION CENTER #T-555
Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
from a spreadsheet posted on the FAA website at https://www.faa.gov/about/office_org/headquarters_offices/ash/ash_programs/hazmat/compliance_enforcement/
Contained in data obtained on August 17, 2017 in response to an open records request.

Private Litigation Case Title: Mesindo Pompa v. Target Corporation et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/254836/target-to-settle-pharmacists-suits-for-3-3m

Description: Racial discrimination. The lawsuit alleged that Target's practices regarding criminal background checks on job applicants discriminated against African-Americans and Latinos.
Private Litigation Case Title: Times et al v. Target Corporation
Info Source: http://www.naacpldf.org/press-release/job-applicants-enter-settlement-target-corporation-over-discriminatory-criminal-backgr

Private Litigation Case Title: Murphy et al v. Target Corporation et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1066403/target-s-9m-paga-deal-ending-seating-suits-ok-d

Description: Target Corporation agreed to pay a total of $3,000,000 to resolve allegations that it violated the federal False Claims Act and Massachusetts False Claims Act by submitting claims for payment to Massachusetts' Medicaid program in violation of rules prohibiting Medicaid prescriptions from being automatically refilled.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/usao-mn/pr/target-corporation-pay-3000000-resolve-false-claims-act-allegations-concerning-auto

Private Litigation Case Title: Freckleton v. Target Corporation et al
Info Source: https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/4286973/freckleton-v-target-corporation/

Description: Wal-Mart Stores, Inc., and its affiliate, Wal-Mart.com, Inc.; Target Corporation and its affiliate, Target.Direct, LLC; and Office Depot, Inc., and its affiliate Viking Office Products, Inc. paid a total of $2,411,714 in taxes they failed to collect because they argued the dot-coms were separate companies not located in Illinois. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided equally among Wal-Mart, Target and Office Depot.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20041222061833/http://www.ag.state.il.us//pressroom/2004_12/20041210b.html

Description: Target agreed to pay $3 million in settlement of allegations it improperly billed Medicaid when it automatically refilled prescriptions that were not specifically requested by the patient, violating Medicaid regulations.
Info Source: https://wayback.archive-it.org/1101/20181226033644/https://www.mass.gov/news/target-to-pay-3-million-over-allegations-of-operating-an-unauthorized-automatic-refill-program

Description: Target agreed to pay $25,000 in settlement of allegations it overcharged public entities for prescription drugs under the workers' compensation insurance system.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20120901090627/http://www.mass.gov/ago/news-and-updates/press-releases/2012/2012-07-03-walmart-target-agreement.html

Description: Target agreed to pay $18.5 million to settle multistate limitation alleging that over 40 million customers had their payment card information compromised during the 2013 holiday season after the company failed to provide reasonable data security.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-becerra-target-settles-record-185-million-credit-card-data

Description: A group of major retailers and a group of jewelry manufacturers joined a settlement involving the presence of lead in costume jewelry sold to children.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-lockyer-announces-settlement-major-us-companies-reduce-lead

Description: Target Corporation agreed to pay $209,000 to resolve an investigation into the retailer's 2013 data breach that affected 700,000 Kentuckians.
Info Source: Beshear: Target Pays Kentucky $200,000 in Penalties, Agress to Stronger Customer Safeguards in 2013 Data Breacj Settlement, States News Service, May 23, 2017 (via Nexis).
http://www.nj.gov/oag/newsreleases09/pr20091110b.html

Description: The California Attorney General, together with 24 local government attorneys, announced a $7.4 million statewide settlement, including enhanced environmental compliance measures and injunctive terms, with Minnesota-based Target Corporation to resolve allegations that Target violated state laws and injunctive terms from a 2011 stipulated judgment regarding the company's handling and disposal of retail hazardous waste.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-becerra-announces-74-million-statewide-settlement-target

Description: The case alleged that Target's job screening process discriminated against African-American and Latino applicants.
Private Litigation Case Title: Times et al v. Target Corporation
Info Source: https://biglawbusiness.com/target-to-pay-3-7m-to-settle-criminal-history-hiring-bias-suit

Description: Target Corp. agreed to pay over $3.3 million in penalties, plus over half a million dollars in costs and restitution, in settlement of allegations by the District Attorneys of Fresno, Marin, Sonoma, Santa Cruz and Contra Costa counties and the San Diego City Attorney that it overcharged customers at the checkout for products it labeled or advertised at a lower price.
Info Source: https://www.co.fresno.ca.us/Home/ShowDocument?id=10336
Notes: Full amount paid in settlement taken from the San Diego City Attorney press release.

Description: Target Corp. agreed to pay $22.5 million in settlement of allegations by 19 California District Attorneys, the California Attorney General, and the City Attorneys for San Diego and Los Angeles that is violated environmental laws by failing to correctly handle and dispose of hazardous material, including pesticides, paint, aerosols, oven cleaners, pool chemicals, drain openers and other flammable, toxic and corrosive materials.
Info Source: https://www.alcoda.org/newsroom/2011/mar

Description: Target Corp. agreed to pay over $1.7 million in settlement of allegations by the District Attorneys of Fresno, Marin, Sonoma, Santa Cruz and Contra Costa counties that it overcharged customers at the checkout for products it labeled or advertised at a lower price.
Info Source: https://www.co.fresno.ca.us/Home/ShowDocument?id=9936
https://www.eeoc.gov/newsroom/target-corporation-pay-45000-settle-eeoc-disability-discrimination-lawsuit

Description: Target signed a corporate-wide settlement agreement with OSHA in which it agreed to settle a variety of violations for $464,950 and make operational changes.
Agency: Occupational Safety & Health Administration corporate-wide settlements
Info Source: https://www.osha.gov/sites/default/files/2020-10/TARGET-corporation-settlement-agreement_0.pdf

Description: payment to consumers in data breach case
Private Litigation Case Title: IN RE: Target Corporation Customer Data Security Breach Litigation
Info Source: http://www.homedepotbreachsettlement.com/

Description: payment to financial institutions in connection with a data breach
Private Litigation Case Title: IN RE: Target Corporation Customer Data Security Breach Litigation
